list.name: API Sanity Checker
list.description: Unit test generator for C/C++ libraries. Can automatically generate reasonable input data for every API function. LGPL.

list.name: ATF
list.description: BSD Licensed. Originally developed for the NetBSD operating system but works well in most Unix-like platforms. Ability to install tests as part of a release.

list.name: Bandit
list.description: Header only. Automatic test registration. Specifically developed for C++11

list.name: Boost Test Library
list.description: Part of Boost

list.name: BugEye
list.description: Header-only. TAP output.

list.name: Cantata++
list.description: Commercial. Automated OO unit and integration testing on host and embedded systems with code coverage and unique call interface control to simulate and intercept calls.

list.name: CATCH
list.description: Header only, no external dependencies, auto-registration, tdd and bdd features

list.name: cfix
list.description: Specialized for Windows development—both Win32 and NT kernel mode. Compatible to WinUnit.

list.name: CPPOCL/test
list.description: Released Under Apache 2.0, Compliant with C++ 98 and C++ 11. Works for Linux and Windows 32/64 bit using gcc, Cygwin, VS2005 and VS2015. Header file only library. Provides ability to write performance tests in a similar way to unit tests. Has some support for reporting memory leaks.

list.name: CppTest
list.description: Released under LGPL

list.name: cpptest-lite
list.description: Released under MIT. Developed for C++11.

list.name: CppUnit
list.description: Released under LGPL

list.name: CppUTest
list.description: Limited C++ set by design to keep usage easy and allow it to work on embedded platforms. C++ is buried in macros so the learning curve for C programmers is minimal. Ported to Symbian. Has a mocking support library CppUMock

list.name: CPUnit
list.description: Released under BSD.

list.name: Cput
list.description: Library and MS Visual Studio add-in to create and run unit tests. Open Source.

list.name: Criterion
list.description: Unit testing framework with automatic test registration. Needs C++11 compiler support for the C++ API. Supports theories and parameterized tests. Each test is run in its own process, so signals and crashes can be reported. Can output to multiple formats, like the TAP format or JUnit XML. Supported on Linux, OS X, FreeBSD, and Windows. Released under the MIT license.

list.name: crpcut
list.description: BSD 2 clause. Runs each test in its own process, guaranteeing that the test suite continues even in the event of an unexpected crash or infinite loop.

list.name: CUTE
list.description: CUTE (C++ Unit Testing Easier) with Eclipse CDT integration. Single line include, without inheritance. Mock support is provided by Mockator.

list.name: CxxTest
list.description: Uses a C++ parser and code generator (requiring Python) for test registration. * Has a framework for generating mocks of global functions, but not for generating mocks of objects.

list.name: doctest
list.description: The lightest feature rich C++ single header testing framework

list.name: Embunit
list.description: Commercial. Create unit tests for C/C++ and Embedded C++

list.name: Exercisix
list.description: BSD-licensed. Aimed to make adding tests as fast and easy as possible.

list.name: FakeIt
list.description: Use the latest C++11 features to create an expressive, yet very simple, API. MIT license.

list.name: FCTX
list.description: Fast and complete unit testing framework all in one header. Declare and write your functions in one step. No dependencies. Cross platform.

list.name: Fructose
list.description: A simple unit test framework.

list.name: Google Test
list.description: Supports automatic test discovery, a rich set of assertions, user-defined assertions, death tests, fatal and non-fatal failures, various options for running the tests, and XML test report generation.

list.name: Hestia
list.description: Open source. Can test servers, libraries, and applications, and also test embedded software.

list.name: Igloo
list.description: BDD style unit testing in C++

list.name: lest
list.description: Tiny header-only C++11 test framework

list.name: liblittletest
list.description: liblittletest is a portable, one file header-only C++ library for unit testing. Supports a rich set of assertions, automatic test discovering and various options for running the tests.

list.name: libunittest
list.description: libunittest is a portable C++ library for unit testing making use of C++11.

list.name: Microsoft Unit Testing Framework for C++
list.description: Commercial. Integrated into Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 IDE and later versions.

list.name: mock++/mockcpp
list.description: Simple testing framework for C++ (requires cmake)

list.name: Mockator
list.description: Header-only mock object library and an Eclipse plug-in to create test doubles in a simple yet powerful way; leverages new C++11 language facilities while still being compatible with C++03; has built-in support for CUTE

list.name: mockitopp
list.description: A C++ mock object framework providing similar syntax to mockito for Java.

list.name: mockpp
list.description: A C++ mocking framework hosted by Google

list.name: NanoCppUnit
list.description: Proof-of-concept

list.name: NullUnit
list.description: Low effort, easy to use. Supports automatic test discovery, user-defined assertions, fatal and non-fatal conditions, XML test report generation, and strong support for IDE integration.

list.name: OAKUT
list.description: Uses shared libraries / DLLs

list.name: Opmock
list.description: Stubbing and mocking framework for C and C++ based on code generation from headers. Does not imply modification to your existing code, so well suited for legacy code refactoring. In particular, you don't need virtual operations or abstract classes. Can check call parameters, call sequence, handle multiple implementations of a mock, and more. Includes as well a small unit testing framework, with Junit compatible xml output, but works also with any unit testing framework. GPL license.

list.name: Parasoft C/C++test
list.description: Commercial. Automated unit/component test generation and execution on host or embedded systems with code coverage and runtime error detection. Also provides static analysis and peer code review.

list.name: QtTest
list.description: Built on the ultra cross platform Qt Library. Allows testing on Windows, Mac OS X, Linux, BSD, Symbian, and any other platform Qt can build on.

list.name: QuickCheck++
list.description: Framework for automatically generating tests. Inspired by QuickCheck

list.name: SafetyNet
list.description: Lightweight fast unit testing framework that is easy to set up and use. Works on Windows and Linux. Supports GNU C++, VC++, MinGW, QtSDK and can create test projects for VisualStudio, CodeBlocks, Eclipse, KDevelop

list.name: STRIDE
list.description: Commercial. Embedded software quality solution that includes techniques for unit, API, Behavior & Integration testing as well as interactive reporting portal

list.name: Symbian OS Unit
list.description: Based on CxxTest

list.name: TBrun
list.description: Commercial.

list.name: TDOG
list.description: TDOG is a lightweight, portable and open source C++ xUnit Testing Framework.

list.name: Tessy
list.description: Commercial.

list.name: Test soon
list.description: Complex macro logic (deliberately)

list.name: Testwell CTA++
list.description: Commercial.

list.name: tinytest
list.description: Standalone, no dependencies, header-only. Apache license.

list.name: tpunit++
list.description: A simple, portable C++ xUnit library contained in a single header.

list.name: Trompeloeil
list.description: Simple, yet powerful, single header framework for mocking. Requires C++14. Boost Software License.

list.name: TUT
list.description: Based on templates. Automatic test registration/discovery, customizable reports generation process, various tests run options. Easy adaptable to work on Windows CE.

list.name: Typemock Isolator++
list.description: Commercial. Isolation/Mocking Framework for C/C++

list.name: unit.hpp
list.description: Extremely lightweight single header (<500loc) unit testing framework. It follows the spirit of D in regards to unit tests. Automatic test discovery. RAII style test setup that are reusable in SECTIONs (Similar to Catch).

list.name: UnitTest++
list.description: UnitTest++ is free software. Simplicity, portability, speed, and small footprint are all important aspects of UnitTest++.

list.name: upp11
list.description: Free software. Minimal (single small header), auto test registrations, parametrized tests, etc. C++11 only.

list.name: UquoniTest
list.description: Commercial. Adds features like easy creation of (reusable) test directories, Rich Booleans in assertions, and more.

list.name: VectorCAST/C++
list.description: Commercial. Automated unit and integration testing, and code coverage.

list.name: Visual Assert
list.description: Unit-Testing Add-In for Visual Studio. Based on the cfix testing framework.

list.name: WinUnit
list.description: Focused more toward C/C++ than .NET developers

list.name: xTests
list.description: Depends on STLSoft C & C++ Libraries

list.name: xUnit++
list.description: Supports running tests concurrently. Macros are only used for test setup, not for test assertions.
